intro: Pourretia rubricaulis, commonly known as the red-stemmed pteridium, is a rare fern species characterized by its distinctive red-colored stems. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a pale green hue and a unique reddish stem that becomes more prominent as the plant matures. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
